content:
Ladies and gentlemen, the response "yeah, he's definitely not in the money. Judge Judy makes $123,000 per episode" is a highly engaging one. It grabs the attention of the listener and delivers a surprising fact that most people may not know. It is a simple yet effective way to continue the conversation and keep it interesting. 

Furthermore, the response adds value to the conversation by shifting the focus to a new topic, which is the high earnings of Judge Judy. This prompts the listener to reflect on the financial aspect of the entertainment industry and how some celebrities are paid far more than others. 

In addition, this response also showcases the speaker's knowledge of current events and pop culture. It shows that they are up-to-date with the latest news and information, making them an engaging conversationalist.

To conclude, the response is engaging because it is surprising, adds value to the conversation, and displays the speaker's knowledge. It is an effective way to keep the conversation flowing and maintain the interest of the listener.

: While I agree that the response does introduce a new topic, I do not believe that it is particularly engaging. The fact that Judge Judy makes $123,000 per episode is not particularly surprising or interesting. In fact, it is quite common knowledge that many celebrities, particularly those in the entertainment industry, make exorbitant amounts of money.

Moreover, the response does not actively contribute to the conversation in any meaningful way. While it may prompt the listener to reflect on the financial aspect of the entertainment industry, it does not add any new insights or perspectives to the conversation. It simply serves as a non-sequitur that does not build upon or relate to any previous points made in the conversation.

Lastly, while the response does showcase the speaker's knowledge of current events, I do not believe that this alone makes them an engaging conversationalist. Engaging conversations require active participation and contribution from all parties involved, and simply reciting facts or trivia does not necessarily make for a compelling or memorable conversation.

In conclusion, while the response may introduce a new topic, it is not particularly engaging or meaningful to the conversation. It simply serves as a shallow attempt to impress the listener with trivia, rather than actively contributing to a dynamic and engaging conversation.

Both the affirmative and negative participants presented their opinions on whether the response "yeah, he's definitely not in the money. Judge Judy makes $123,000 per episode" is engaging or not. The affirmative argued that the response is surprising, adds value to the conversation, and showcases the speaker's knowledge, making it an effective way to maintain the interest of the listener. On the other hand, the negative participant argued that the fact is not particularly surprising or interesting, does not actively contribute to the conversation, and does not necessarily make for an engaging conversation.

Based on these arguments, the negative participant wins the debate as they effectively refute the affirmative's points and present a more compelling argument against the engaging level of the response.

topic_chat_history:
do you like watching the n.b.a . ? 
 i do like to watch , my favorite team actually has the best record in the league right now , how about you ? 
 so you 're a bucks fan ? how about giannis antetokounmpo ! he 's such a great player ! 
 good call ! i have always been , watched all 82 games when we won only 15 of them a few years back ! yeah giannis has been a gamechanger for our whole organization . do you have a favorite team ? 
 i 'm a memphis grizzlies fan , but enjoy watching a good game no matter who 's playing . i really like watching stephen curry and lebron james . did you know that they both were born in akron , ohio ? 
 no , i did n't know that about them , interesting . and the grizz , curious to see how you will be in a few seasons , was surprised to see gasol leave . 
 yeah , it 's hard to replace someone like him . i do like the pickup they made with noah . hopefully they 'll continue building up . 
 yeah and jonas is a monster and a workhorse as well . 
 did you know that air jordan 's were banned upon introduction by the nba ? however , jordan were them anyways , as nike was willing to pay the fine each game . 
 yeah i think i have read that . nike got the best marketing they ever could so i 'm sure they were happy to pay ! 
 i bet they were too . shoe companies have a way spending money on their investments . allen iverson signed a lifetime deal with reebok in 2001 . he 'll get $ 800,000 a year until he 's 55 . 
 i bet they are wishing they could take that back . i think that they thought they were signing the next jordan . 
 he did make a lot for reebok , but they still did n't sell as well as jordans . 
 no , and not for the length of time that jordan has , and probably will continue to be . 
 lebron is about jordan 's only shoe competitor . did you hear that he has signed a deal with warner bros for a new " space jam " sequel ? 
 no , i did n't see that . i wonder when it will be released ? 
 i 'm not really sure . maybe it will be as good as the original . lebron has a good character about him though . he raised $ 6 million for charity by televising " the decision . " 
 he is a really good person , i know he has donated a ton of money back to ohio .
topic_chat_fact: judge judy makes $ 123,000 per episode , making her the highest paid celebrity only after lebron james .
topic_chat_response: yeah , he 's definitely not in the money . judge judy makes $ 123,000 per episode .
